citations.narrative:
While reviewing acquisition records, it was determined that between 5/17/2025 and 7/15/2025 the facility acquired 5 ring-
tailed lemurs from USDA licensed facilities and transported them in commerce without health certificates. No USDA
licensed person shall transport in commerce a non-human primate unless accompanied by a valid health certificate. This
ensures the animal is free of infectious disease or physical abnormalities that could endanger the animal, other animals or
members of the public. The licensee must have a valid health certificate for regulated dogs, cats and non-human primates
transported in commerce. Correct from this date forward, January 14, 2026.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by March 16, 2026 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.78(a) 
   
Health certification and identification. 
While reviewing acquisition records, it was determined that between 5/17/2025 and 7/15/2025 the facility acquired 5 ring-
tailed lemurs from USDA licensed facilities and transported them in commerce without health certificates. No USDA 
licensed person shall transport in commerce a non-human primate unless accompanied by a valid health certificate. This 
ensures the animal is free of infectious disease or physical abnormalities that could endanger the animal, other animals or 
members of the public. The licensee must have a valid health certificate for regulated dogs, cats and non-human primates 
transported in commerce. Correct from this date forward, January 14, 2026. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by March 16, 2026 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
